CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, national edition, September 12, 1942, pg. 15, reads: "'Double V' Water and Beauty Pageant Reveals Beauty and Patriotism - You may well imagine the tough job the judges had in choosing the winner out of this bevy of beautiful entries who participated in the first annual 'Double V' Water and Beauty Pageant held at Ammon Center last Friday.  The contestants including the names of their sponsors are from left to right: Fannie Henderson, New Kensington Elks; Cecelia Fulwylie, Lincoln Drug Company; Jeanne Tanner, New Kensington Elks; Minerva Coles, Soldiers Service Victory Club; Lillian Wright, Soldiers Service Club; Mary Ellen Auston [Alston], Maude Brown Hat Shop; Arlene Jones, Duck's Club; Vivian Wren, second place winner, Modern Beauty Salon; Francis Weaver, first place winner, New 'V V' Boosters, McClellandtown, Pa.; Gardenia Reed, Hilltop A. C.; Lucille Velar, Jones Beauty Salon; Alma Croom, Housewives Guild; Myrtle Gilkes, third place winner, Harris Studios; Elizabeth Mackell, Arabesque Girls; Agnes Stokes, Crawford Grill; and Helen Haley, New Kensington Elks... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Contestants in Double V Water and Beauty Pageant, from left: Fannie Henderson, Cecelia Fulwylie, Jeanne Tanner, Minerva Coles, Lillian Wright, Mary Ellen Alston, Arlene Jones, Vivian Wren, possibly June Tansimore, Francis or Frances Weaver, Gardenia Reed, Lucille Velar, Alma Croom, Myrtle Gilkes (sponsored by Harris Studio), Elizabeth Mackell, Agnes Reed Stokes, and Helen Haley, posed in Ammon Center
